channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Plympton Road, 20th November
item.description:
Corner with Streatley Road, outside 23 &21. On Tuesday 18/11/25 at 11:56 a delivery lorry knocked down two metal bollards, one on each corner. They are wobbly

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Plympton Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bollard broken and on pavement, 20th November
item.description:
A green bollard at the junction of Alexandra Road and Lennard Road has been (presumably) hit by a vehicle and totally knocked over, also damaging the surrounding pavement. Laying on its side, it is now a trip hazard to pedestrians.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lennard Road, Penge, London Borough of Bromley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Footpath Covered in SLIPPERY WET LEAVES, 20th November
item.description:
Leaves have been falling from the trees and onto the footpath. The leaves are wet and slippery. Some people have already slipped over. It needs to cleared.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mill Lane, South Stifford, Grays

item.title: Left up a tree on public pavment, 20th November
item.description:
The new butchers thats has opened on camberwell new road its read and called mb meat thia is not the first time they are leaveing there rubbish on pavements and they are aslo leaveong there old boxes from meat and vega in a a public phone box witch has now been removed .. they leave it outside the h&t pawnbrokers and makes the business look very unprofessional .. please send them a letter advising to so stop fly tipping as its getting worse everyday .. and the smell is unbearable as some boxes have old meat and veg in please do somone with the business as they are just getting away with it.. many business have comforted them asked them to stop but they won't . Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10-11, Camberwell Green, Camberwell, London Borough of Southwark
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cars Parked on Footpath Dennis Parade, Winchmore Hill Road, London N14 6AA), 20th November
item.description:
I've spotted both of these vehicles parked on the pedestrian footpath everyday for the last two weeks. - Mercedes S-Class: LO68 ZYT - Mercedes C-Class: GN66 VXU Location: Dennis Parade, Winchmore Hill Road, London N14 6AA (Between Ladbrokes & the old Vic Smith Beds). I've reported it to The Enfield Parking Shop (020 3856 0036). The gentleman I spoke with didn't understand what I was saying and when I requested to speak to someone else, the phone was given to a Supervisor who didn't seem bothered at all! What's the point?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3a, Dennis Parade, Southgate, London Borough of Enfield
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Food waste and oil being left outside, 20th November
item.description:
Food waste, oil and rubbish being left out the back of local restaurants. Copper ceylon and Nam Thai on East Street. Both don't have bin collections and bins over flowing. Leaving food waste on the floor and oil. Oil is being put down drains by these restaurants. Rats are in the area and dangerous harardous items being left outside of bins. There are children in the area and considered for there health. Rats have been getting into Bromley council homes and buildings in the area. Unsafe living and food conditions. Under the environment agency act 1990 this needs to be dealt with.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 46, East Street, Plaistow, Bromley, London Borough of Bromley
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Haverstock Hill, Belsize Park, Camden Town, London Borough of Camden
